main_definition: The quality of being honest and having strong moral principles; the state of being whole and undivided.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Adherence to moral and ethical principles in every aspect of life, without compromise
meanings_and_examples.example: Despite facing financial difficulties, John maintained his integrity by refusing to engage in any dishonest activities.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The quality of being honest and fair; the absence of deceit or fraud
meanings_and_examples.example: The company gained a reputation for its commitment to integrity, always delivering on promises made to customers.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Soundness and coherence in character, principles, and actions; wholeness
meanings_and_examples.example: Her unwavering integrity was evident when she stood by her friend despite the community's disapproval of his actions.
